name: methyl_4-phenylbenzoate
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: 4-phenylbenzoic acid has a melting point of 122-123°C. The methyl ester group (COC(=O)) is a common functional group that can increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the ability to participate in hydrogen bonding. The methyl ester group can increase the melting point by approximately 10-15°C.
